channel.title: Help with colors
channel.description: how do you make scar click on colors? i just started today!

item.title: Help with colors
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

I just explained what a variable is.

[quote]
Variables are things in all programming languages that are “able to be varied” (hence variables).
[/quote][/quote]

If your confused on this, variables can hold data. Integers hold numbers, strings hold characters(defined in " ’ "'s), booleans hold true/false. There are more but those are the most used 3.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with colors
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

the VAR thing gives you the ability to setup variables. Variables are things in all programming languages that are “able to be varied” (hence variables). They are useful for holding data such as numbers, strings, an array of numbers, an array of strings, and there are many other possibilities. The example I showed you - x, y, x2, y2 - were set to be integers or Whole Numbers.

Read full topic

thanks! i was stumped on that![br][size=1]Posted at: December 08, 2006, 04:52:04 PM[/size][hr]what do you do with the VAR thing?

item.title: Help with colors
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Here you go.

program New;

const
  // Color to look for.
  SomeColor = 16777215;

// Setup variables.
// x and y are integers which are used to store coords of color location.
// x2 and y2 are integers which are used to store your resolution.
var
  x, y, x2, y2 : integer;
  
begin
  // Set the ClientDimensions to x2 and y2.
  GetClientDimensions(x2, y2);
  // if you find the SomeColor inbetween 0, 0 and x2, y2
  // then store its location to x and y and...
  if(FindColor(x, y, SomeColor, 0, 0, x2, y2))then
  begin
    // Left click on the location of that color.
    ClickMouse(x, y, True);
  end;
end.

~Ron

Read full topic
